intro: Calandrinia quadrivalvis, commonly known as the four-valved portulaca, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Portulacaceae and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant, colorful flowers. The plant produces four valves on its fruit, which is a unique feature contributing to its common name. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, making it a hardy species adapted to drought conditions. Calandrinia quadrivalvis is often grown as an ornamental plant due to its attractive appearance and low maintenance requirements.
